text: 500 ml bottle, served in mug. Dark brown-red colour, big fluffy head. Dark bread, roasted malt, a bit coffee, ends with a bit lemon. Very nice and balanced taste, malty and slightly bitter, slightly sour. Nice palate, very smooth. Medium body, oily texture. Great Dunkles!
Clear dark brown beer with nice beige head stayed. Aroma is yeast, malts, roasted bread. Taste is also nice sweet malty, bready and light bitter. Nice tasting dry finish. Good beer.
Dunkel / Schwarz im Glas mit cremefarbener Krone. Vollmundiger, brotiger, röstiger Geschmack.

Clean brown color with an off white head. Toasted malt and pils yeast aroma. Clean light malt body.

Flesje gedeeld tijdens proeverijtje. Koperkleurig helder bier. Aroma is caramel achtig en fruitig. Smaak is zoet en fruitig. Nasmaak is iets bitter.

Pours a dark brown. Malty and bready aromas. Tastes much the same. Not much in the way of hop bitterness. Pretty decent German dunkel.
Aroma of malt, grain and bread. Taste of roasted malt,brown sugar,bread,caramel.very tasty.
Bottle 50 cl. Amber, clear with a medium creamy offwhite head. Aroma of malt, grain and bread. Light bitter with a dry and bread. Not bad.
Clear mahogany colored pour with a large beige head and great retention. Good lacing. Thin mouthfeel. Smooth and clean dark caramel lager with a light smoke background. Simple and yummy.
Beautiful mahogany with cream colored head. Worty aroma with a little spice, yeast and roasted barley. Mild chocolate malt flavors with a hint of nuts. Low bitterness with a nutty finish. Excellent!

Draught. Sweet aroma of caramel, roasted malts and bread. Flavour is malty sweet with only a slight bitter finish.
Bottle. Dark mahogany colour. Roasted malts. Strong caramel flavour. Toffee and dark burnt sugar. Some chocolate and fruitiness. Sweet but with dry malty finish. (2008)
Særdeles god mørk øl, der dog skydedr over mål med at kalde sig "Das Beste Dunkel, der Welt". Tilpas med sødme og bitterhed, Flot udseende,
500ml bottle from the Old Fishing Shack Pub in Paphos. Pours reddish brown with a large beige head. Aroma is dark bread, treacle, light roasted malts. Taste is caramel, brown bread, light roastiness.

Clear amber colour with a good, rapidly evaporating beige head. Slightly thin aroma with a lot of malt, bread, plum and dark sugar. Flavour is also very bready especially in the finish. Low carbonation and a nice mouthfeel, somewhat thin body. Quite good.
Clear brown with white head. Chocolate, toffee and nuts. Sweet, round, roast and hoppy finish. Great! Refined.
medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

50cl bottle pours a dark copper/brown with a small beige head and a little lacing. Aroma has raisins, nuts, roasted grains and caramel. Taste is slightly sweet with a bitter finish. Body is medium to light with lively carbonation and a crisp mouthfeel. This is well-balanced and refreshing

Bottle from Getränke Hoffmann - clear mahagoni color with thick head. Taste is canne sugar, toffee, dried dark fruits, all very subtle. Body is a bit watery. Finish is short. Okay Dunkel.

Drinking from a 0,5 l bottle. 
In the aroma caramel, butter.
The clear brown beer has a medium off white head. 
In the taste chocolate, malt. 
Medium carbonated.
Cerveza color oscuro, tipico dunkel alemana, maltas tostadas suaves, cafe, agradable de beber

Bottle shared in the train massive thanks to deanso! Clear dark brown with big beige head. Caramel, light milk chocolate, dusty, dried figs, light dry sugary notes, a bit of wood and earth. Light sweet and bitter. Just medium bodied.

Gran Cerveza. 
"Suaves y equilibrados sabores donde esta cerveza destaca, al sorprender con un toque stout al paladar, algo a lo que no nos tienen acostumbradas las cervezas de Múnich ni las típicas cervezas de abadía (o monasterio), en el que reconocemos las maltas tostadas y caramelizadas y matices de café, siendo poco seca y apagándose paulatinamente en el paladar" El Jardín del Lúpulo

Bottle (1 pint 0.9 oz). Pours bronze color with light beige head. Bread crust aroma with caramel notes. Bread crust malt with caramel notes. Light-medium body.

Aroma: crusty bread, dark malts, caramel.
Appearance: clear deep amber coor and thin white head.
Taste: low herbal bitterness, roasted dark malts, crunchy bread, caramel, quite dry.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation, roasted finish.

Bottle. Pours a mild red-brown with a medium, light tan, lacy head. Nose is a veritable fruitcake -- nuts, brandy-soaked dried fruit, pastry flour, spices. On the tongue, it bursts with sweetness and nuttiness; complex and rich, much deeper than most American dunkels (and for that matter, most German ones). Multiple layers of flavor; theres a wine-like complexity to it. Finishes long, with notes of smoked fig. Really good.
A következő nyakatekert okoskodást ötlöttem ki: olyan mint egy barokk esküvő, egy kis copf-fal (nem fru-fru) és rokokóval elegyítve, de még mindenképp a klasszicista jegyek nélkül.

hazy brown with creamy tan head. creamy full body with moderately high carbonation.

aroma: dark bread crust, coffee, cacao, stone, wood ash, earthy floral leafy hops.

taste: faint char and acidic notes from roasted grains, bready malt sweetness, dark bread, floral hops, same melanoidin-rich finish as the helles.

Not as quaffable by itself as the helles, but would most likely stand up better to the richness of most bavarian dishes.

Pours out of the bottle a very nice looking deep brown. Frothy tan head settles to a thin lace. Wonderful rich and roasty flavors. Nicely balanced. Body is medium. Not too heavy and not too thin. A superb example of the style.

Bottle from market street wine shop uptown. Pours medium brown, clear, with an inch of reddish-tan head. Lightly smoked aroma with earth, cola, leaves. Flavor is roasted leaves, caramel, light dried grass. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours brown from the bottle with a foamy head that gently subsides into whispy, creamy lacing. Aroma is of german black bread and roasted caramel malt. A floral hint hovers in the background. Taste is sweet caramel, very smooth, and finishes with two contrasting notes. First is the bitter dark chocolate that rises to the foreground, and second is the hops driven sourness that unfolds on the swill. Both tastes compete with each other, but still maintain a pleasant harmony. Robust despite the low ABV, and yet refreshing as well. Well balanced. An excellent German "dunkles", one of the best of the style that I have tasted.

Poured from a nicely chilled pint & 0.9 oz. brown glass bottle into a dimpled mug and 1st impression is the dark, rich earthen color; not too much nose; but the taste has a deep chocolaty nuttiness. 
Overall, a supurb dark brew; VERY enjoyable.

On tap at PIB 2016, pours a hazy chestnut brown with a medium beige head. Aroma brings out toasted nuts, bready malt and restrained toasted caramel. Flavour is along the same lines, with toasted nuts, bready malt and caramel. Solid enough and appropriate to style, just not overly interesting.

Superior

Pretty good beer, very crisp. Medium body, low carbonation. (Good) Yeast flavours dominate the beer. Schroeder's SF.

Aug. 15. A 0.5 l bottle, poured a dark brown body with big, but short living brownish head. Caramel, light wood and cocoa in aroma. Flavor was lightly sweet, pleasant dark Munich malt evindent, the real deal. Quite simple though, caramel and some light fruitiness plus sugar. Medium bodied, moderate caramel finish. Quite fine dunkel, but really, ratebeer, the Top50?

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2016 Some light roast and a hint of citrus. Some lightly tangy malt. Decent for style, with light coffee hint. Some coppery flavor and leather. Tangy with a pretty clean finish. Bottle.

Bottle, 500ml. Clear reddish maple with a creamy tan head. Sweet roasted and toffee aromas. Medium bodied with moderate to fizzy carbonation. Medium sweet with low bitterness. Pleasant roasted character intoa somewhat watery finish. Quite pleasant.

This abbey beer presents a beautifully opalescent nutty brownish colour with a resistent pearly foam.
Its aromas are most from dried fruits like dried dates and figs, the malty aromas are very soft on the nose with a timid resemblance of toffee. In the mouth it is very fresh, with a duality of acidity and bitterness, even though both very elegant. Its has no weight on the mouth and is a crispy beer, easy to drink

Aroma is roasted malts, caramel, toffee, fig and pecans. Taste is an almost chewy mouth feel of caramel and toffee with some very faint bittering hops that mellow out well. Appearance is a clear amber with a medium pearl head with lacing that retains fairly well.
0,5l bottle. Pours dark amber with big head. Aroma of raisins, caramel, hey. Nice bitter sweet taste of caramel a hint of coffee. Low carbonation, medium body. Short aftertaste

Dark bronze with little dark beige head. Dark aromas like chocolate, smoke and dried fruit. Maybe some walnuts. Also a decent sour hop note. Taste is very bitter but likable. Thin texture, full body. I like it!
Bottle. Clear dark brown colour. Caramel aroma. Light body, caramel, chocolate taste

500ml brown bottle. Colour is brassy orange, crystal clear, a fat beige cap on top. Aromas of bread, toffee, light chocolate. Flavours of chocolate and caramel with a slight metallic note. Lightly toasted malt aftertaste with nutty chocolate malt. Quite a nice dunkel, better than expected and a very easy drinker.
How : bottle Appearance : almost clear dark red with a medium off-white head. Aroma : rye bread, dark syrup, red berries, plums and some spice. Palate : medium body, average to soft carbonation.

Bottle from Hipercor, lote L245, best before 2/9/2016. Amber coloured with a large off-white head. Nose is sweet caramel, bit of grassy, nutty. Flavour is caramel malts, bready, light grassy, some sweetness.

500ml bottle pours amber in color with a 2 finger off-white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is caramel with some grassy and grainy notes. Taste is a caramel malty sweetness with some grassy and herbal hop bitterness. Medium bodied with mediocre carbonation. Overall, this brew is quite sweet with a decent amount of bitterness, but how it won a World Beer Award in 2004 is beyond me.

Pretty delicious. Malty, caramel and toffee breads. Nicely done with a bit of a bread note and light grassy hops. Well balanced and easy sipping.

Yields a clear, dark brown color, with fiery ember hints in it. Has a very fluffy, huge white head, which doesnt collide at all.

Smells of whole-grain bread, accompanied by toffee malts and a convincing amount of earth. On the nose, this beer reminds me of an malt beer, while providing more body and revealing more earth than sugar.

Has a very creamy mouthfeel, revealing a vivid carbonation, showcasing a malt driven, earthy beer. Drinks very clean throughout, while malts define the taste at all stages.

Tastes of rustic bread, accompanied by cocoa nibs and a whiff of coca-cola, all wrapped up into the beers profound, earthy maltiness. Turns a tad more into a toffee direction, while the beer remains very silk on the palate, finishing with a bubbly, decent bitterness, adding a nice complexity to the malts.

Convinces by its perfect malt balance, resulting in a very focused beer with a pleasant depth, heading completely into the malt direction.

Klosterbrauerei Weltenburg, Kelheim, Germany. Barock Dunkel, 4.7% (cask at the Bierbörse Bonn). Mahogany, clear, with small, creamy beige head. Aroma of toasted malts, rye bread, caramel. Medium to full body, hardly watery. Rye bread (wee sour), caramel, dry licorice at first. Some chocolate and coffee malts - more so towards the middle. Still a slight licorice touch, into the finish. Which has espresso bitter notes, soft faintly sweet malt, but aftertaste is dry, bitter expresso. Lasting. Very good Dunkles, not really a session beer due to its dryness.

The body of an average, more than "11" rather than "12". The taste malty, slightly sweet, slightly caramelized, slightly pechenisty sufficiently soft and buttery. Feels toasted bread. Hops are present, but the taste a bit. The finish is long, caramel-grain, malt, balanced.

330ml bottle into glass. Room temperature. Rich inviting nose, dark chocolate, coffee, smoked meats. Clear ruby red beer with a few bubbles. Solid white head. Easy drinking, body is quite thin. Finish is clean, a bit sour, a touch of smoke, some malt sweetness. Balanced and quite subtle. You could drink a lot of these, oh yeah!

Keg at Piccadilly Tap, Manchester. Dark reddish brown. Short golden head. Some lacing. Earthy, lightly toasted malts. Notes of toffee and a kind of winey fruitiness beneath it all. Pretty sweet though; I wasnt really prepared for that. Decent for the style.

Bottle. Probably on of the best Dunkel in the world and one of my favorite beers. The Barock pours dark amber colored and clear with a long lasting full fine-frothy tan head. The aroma that gets into the nose already gives and great impression of the richness and complexity of this beer. The sweet smell comes along with strong notes of honey and sherry, as well as some hints of plum. In the back lays a spicy foundation brought by the hops. While the honey and sherry notes also dominate the flavor and are accompanied by malty sweetness, more and more hoppier notes of spices and herbs also make the Barock more dry and bitter. While the aroma and taste is complex the body is surprisingly light but well structured with medium carbonation. Because of that is mouthfeel is slightly fizzy and crisp and give the Barock a refreshing character. Finally the finish is bitter-dry and leaves a pleasant and long dry aftertaste which keeps the honey and sherry notes. Highly recommended!

Maybe one of the top 3 beer I have ever had. A tremendously nutty taste that is full of sweet and sharp notes. A must have.

Pleasing flavor rolls caramel, toasted malt, apple, pear, and even a little woody hops across the palate. Body and fizz are not strong, but finish is pleasing. Zehr gut Bier!

Pours a ruby colour with a not very long lasting tan head. aromas of malt, dark fruits, raisins and sweet chocolate comes into mind. Flavours of malt, toffee and some herbal hops with a overall dry finish. Good one.

Overall dry taste with some balancing caramel sweetness. Flavors of milk chocolate, red fruits, plums, grains, dark bread. Balanced nutty bitterness with fruity coffee notes.

500cc bottle. Pours red brown with tanned head. Beautiful malt a caramel. I get some yeast in the nose. All the sweetness in nicely balanced. Some discret hop flavour. One of the best commercial dunkels I have had.

Bottled. Poured a deep red tinged. brown with white head. Delicious malty core predominates with hints of nut. A great dunkel.
Espuma que se disipa rápidamente, color marrón anaranjado, aroma tostado en nariz bastante intenso, suave con graduación baja y sabores tostados muy sabrosos con regusto agradable.

One of my favourite beers in price/quality almost in Spain, i would like taste this in its own brewery, aroma is probably the weakest of it, appearance its clear, brown with red shades. the head is durably, but there is little, colour white with little beige. the taste is caramel, chocolate/coffee, low bread, fresh and little woody. 

Sometimes i think is a bit watery, but for that price 1,15 is great, it was one of first imported beers i drinked

500ml bottle at Riedelsbach. Aroma is malty, coffee, roasted nuts. Appearance is dark, ruby-ish (more amber), with a brown-ish foam. Taste is sweet and light bitter. A soft carbonation with a light dryness. Very nice.
Cerveja abadia com coloração marrom, tem um sabor marcante e forte, não deixa amargor residual fazendo com que cada gole possa ser apreciado. O aroma é bastante agradável

Poured from a 500cl bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has a sweet roasted malt smell
Appearance- The brew is a dark brown color with a red tint and has a large tan head.
Taste- Has a great strong malt flavor that has a hint of sweetness to eat.
Palate- A Medium-bodied beer with moderate carbonation 
Overall An excellent brew. highly recommended

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2015 Clear, brown colour, lasting beige head. Smells of coke, nuts, salt, smoke and caramel. Taste is bitter with a roasted touch, the palate is on the medium side. Decent, even though this is one of my least favourite styles...
500ml botle at Bierhof Athens. Dark brown color with beige head. Malty caramel aroma, roasted, dusty. Sweet and light bitter taste, roasted. Light to medium body oily with soft carbonation.

Bottle from Cool Wine Hobart 290115. This is one of the best of not the best dunkel I have had. Why are there not more dunkels brewed in Australia. Sweet banana, caramel and toffee flavours wrap themselves around the tongue in a warm embrace and dont let go. Great beer.

500ml Bottle from Beers of Europe:
This one was another very nice beer from the brewery, Im not entirely sure but my thinking is that last years came out slightly better but this one is still an excellent beer and one well worth picking up. The taste was a sweet and nutty one but certainly wasnt overdone and managed to strike a great balance as I sipped away at it for quite some time; good stuff.
Dunkel Braun, klar, leichter brauner schaum, schön malzig in der Nase, leichter Körper, extrem süffig mit angenehmer süße.
Bottle a brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts caramel nuts spicy and fruits flavor malts spicy some caramel fruits and some hops

Look: Pours with average, thick/creamy light mocha top with some unwanted big bubbles. Good and steady retention, the head mostly diminishes but there is still fine lacing through. Clear, dark amber/brown (strong cherry hue), carbonation chains visible.


Smell: Toasty (white bread), caramel, sticky burned sugar and soft roast. Nuts, dates and other sweet dry fruits, light hay from hops.


Taste: Light, playful sweetness at start, mostly caramel, burned sugar and candy that goes to nuts and dry fruits. Continues to light/medium sweet middle with grain and caramel notes. Ends with very light sugary bitterness form noble hops. Some roast, honey and dates come out in the aftertaste. 


Mouthfeel: Medium light heavy, lively carbonation, very chewy. 


Overall: One of the prime examples of the style, worth a try and an easy go to beer.

Crystal clear deep amber with ruby red reflections and a medium light beige-tan pillowy head. Noses of caramel, toffee, toasted bread, treacle-sirup malt with light faint herbal notes to it. Lightly carbonated and softly textured. Leans to the malty sweet side with a sugared her note. Surprising light body offering overall a high drinkability - quaffable! the finish is harmonically lingering on the palate. Excellent dunkel!
Shared bottle at annual yule beer tasting on board Fridtjofen 06.12.14. Clear copper. Beige head. Berries, caramel and malt in aroma and taste. Fine bitterness in aftertaste.
Smells like caramel malts, chocolate and bit of raisins. Tastes sweet, almost no bitterness. Its a honest dunkel with high drinkability, like a little brother of a belgian dubbel.

A dark export beer. A specialty of well-balanced richness and fine elegance. World Beer Award 2004

Botella de 50 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color marron. Sabor a malta tostada, cafe, chocolate.
clear red brown pour. aroma hay, horse grain, concord grapes, soy sauce. Tastes soy, smokey grill, lactic milk caramel. Dry creamy palate with some sediment in a good way.

Kaatuu lasiin colanruskeana ja "kirkkaana", noin kolmen sormuisen vaahtokukan suojaamana. Tuoksusta löytyy hyvin vahvana paahdetta ja täysjyväleipää, keskiverrosti makeaa marjaisuutta ja heikosti ruohoa ja kukkaisuutta. Maussa paahdetta, ruisleipää ja makeaa hunajaisuutta on juuri sopivassa tasapainossa, kukkaisuuden tullessa hentona mukaan kuvaan jälkimaussa. Suutuntuma on makeahko ja hieman ohut, humala potkaisee hieman lopussa. Hyvä tumma lager, jossa olisi ehkä sen 0,5% saanut olla lisää alkoholia, joka olisi tuonut täyteläisyyttä. Tyyylinsä parhaita, vaikka tummat lagerit ovat itselle hieman tylsiä.

50cl Bottle from douberd, thanks Christos! Clear dark chestnut brown colour, creamy beige head. Aroma of cocoa, toast, nuts, some roasted malts, light fruity. Flavour is medium sweet, malty, some dark fruits, mostly toast and a hint of coffee-like roast, nice bitterness, light nutty, decent bitter finish. Light-bodied. Good.

(Bue sur place): Des grains torréfiés hyper secs nous accueillent pour laisser place à des sucres rôtis qui souvrent exponentiellement et se prolongent en bouche. Un liquide qui cache sa sécheresse à lentrée et sa richesse à la fin, ça fonctionne et cest délicieux.

My Bottom Line:
Cherries, earthen forests, coffee and toast coalesce in this initially dry then chewy Dunkel. Quite the trekking experience!

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A lingering head of foam covers the dark brown with ochre highlights.
-The aroma on this one leaps out of the pint glass.
-The flavor profile is able to follow through as well. Expertly crafted.
-The soft bubbling makes the palate focus on the malt and hop interplay.
-Drinkability is as high as the pleasure gotten from every sip.

On tap at the kloster.

500ml served in a pokal glass.
A: Pours a deep amber clear color forming a small yellow head leaving some lacings
S: Sweet, smoky, toffee and roasted. Fruity too. Not bad at all
T: Sweet upfront, very toffee. Grapes, sweet grains, yeasts. Very bready
M: Light to medium and bit molasses body. Sweet toffee upfront and very mild bitter aftertaste
O: Good drinkability. Bit too sweet but nice beer
[ BA Review @ 8/1/2012 ]

Bottle at Cafe Brecht. Clear deep brown pour with med foamy white head. Aroma is nutty, really nice nutty character, light fruity aromas, light yeastiness, pretty clean overall, light toasted notes. Taste is sweet, chewy the maltiness, toasty and nutty. Palate is med-full bodied but still fluffy, really.
Bottle (from lidl!). Dark brown, clear. Dark malty, slight syrupy, nose. Smooth bodied, flavourful nice. Dark malty bread, chestnuts, caramel. Real nice surprise. Clean, good flavour, nice intensity.

From bottle. Bittersweet caramelly maltiness. Nice dark rhum / clear Brown caramel color. Poor foam: 1 finger and disappears instantly. A very good beer in the style. Great to enjoy with salty nuts, spicy curries or bitter foods.

Aroma is deep sweet dark munich malt, light chocolate toffee bread crust. Appearance is crystal clear dark brown with a hint of red, small tan head that dissipates quickly. Taste is rich munich malt, toffee, chocolate, bread crust. No hop flavor. Palate is medium light and crisp. Huge malt depth while still being delicate. Overall an excellent beer. Easily the best of the style I have had.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into a glass. Pours really dark brown with two finger beige head. Aroma is milk chocolate, medium body, medium/light carbonation, and pretty good small-bubble lacing. Taste is milk chocolate, dark malt, some nuts, and hints of roast. Easy to drink and nice beer.

50cl bottle from Trimk Gut, Munster.
Thick creamy off whirte head. Clear amber pour. Nice smooth aftertaste. A pretty good dunkel.
0,5l Flasche. Dunkelbraunes Bier mit beiger Schaumkrone. Riecht intensiv nach Malz. Schmeckt malzig mit Nuancen nach Nüssen. Lecker!

0,5 l bottle, dark red brown in the glass, a lot of CO2 pearls. Small head. Maybe it was too cold. Dark malty on the nose. Starst darker, roasted malt, neraly coffie and dark chocolate. Low sweetness. Malty ending.

(Flasche) Es hat eine dunkelbraune Farbe mit starkem Bronzenen Einstich, ist klar filtriert mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist malzig, karamellig mit einer leicht röstigen Note. Der Geschmack ist recht röstig, sonst eher schlank mit einer leichten Süße und einer mittleren Bittere. Im Nachgeschmack bleibt eine breite, holzige Bitterre auf der Zunge
Klar rødbrun farge med et beige skum. Aroma av malt, karamell, nøtter, røstet malt og hint av kaffe. Smaken følger aroma, lett bitterhet i avsluttningen.
Very nice beer. Biscuit, toasty, with slight sweetness throughout. Had mine on tap and wonder how it would be out of the bottle. Good representation of the style
Very nice dark beer. Aroma of chocolate and caramel. Amber color with beige head. Taste is sweet at first, but it gets bitter at the end. Medium body, lively carbonation.
Robijnrood bier met schuim. Smaak is rokig en licht bitter, caramel , met kers en braam ondertoon. Drinkt lekker weg en blijft lang hangen.
Aroma de nozes e adocicado. No sabor, começa num agridoce (com destaque para o doce da uva passa) que se transforma em um torrado de maltes no final seco.

Bottle. Clear brown with a nice big, beige head. Aromas of cacao, toffee and espresso. Taste is bitter and a bit spur at first, then goes over to a short sweetness with a prolonged bitterness. Average carbonation with watery texture. Aftertaste with much chocolate and coffee. 

Weltenburger brews really good beers, until now I´ve never been disappointed by them.

Clear chestnut color, medium sized off-white head, big lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, coffee and traces of nuts. Medium bitter taste, long coffee finish. Medium body, average carbonation. Great dunkel.(Pivkan 0,5l bottle)
50cl bottle shared by Mikke. Pours clear copper with a small, tan head. Mild roasty aroma with notes of raisins, malt and hints of caramel and hops. Medium sweet, but fairly balanced. Quite nice!
On tap at Barrels & Bottles. Light brown appearance with an off-white head. Malty, caramel, toffee and light noble hops. Smooth and creamy with a light body and soft carbonation.

On tap at Maffei at Riva del Garda
Clear brown/red, brown head
Caramel, lightly roasted malts, chocolate and licorice
Taste follow aroma spoiled by a hint of metallic
Good beer
Pours clear deep brown color with nice tan head. Aroma is coffee, caramel, roasted malts, maybe hints of nuts. Taste is sweet followed by some bitterness. Not bad.
Deep brown with a light tan head. Malty with hints of caramel and nut, a bit of earthy qualities. Balanced and full with a smooth finish.
Âmbar com pouca de espuma. Aroma e sabor com notas de malte caramelo, leve dulçor e pouco lúpulo. Média carbonatação e corpo leve
On tap at the monastery. Pours dark brown to red with nice tan head. Aroma is cocoa, caramel, roasted malt. Flavor is roasted malt, spicy hops, licorice.

Serving: from bottle--purchased at Allendörfer 

Aroma: light caramel malt.

Appearance: small, frothy, off-white initial head with no lacing and fully diminishing longevity. Clear, dark-orange/light-brown body.

Taste: moderately sweet, caramel malt initial flavor and moderately sweet, caramel malt and slightly bread-like finish with average duration.

Palate: medium body, watery texture and soft carbonation.

Overall: excellent flavor.  A great dunkel.

Bottle, 50cl at supermarket El Corte Ingles in Seville.
dark brown colour. beige head. (two fingers) not too persistent, but leaves crown. trancelucid. Not sparkling. 
Chocolate, cereal in aroma.
taste: medium sweet, light bitter, medium sour. Balanced.
Medium - light body, oily. lively carbonation in mouth. 
some long astringent finish.

Tasted on weltenburg brewery guided tour. Nice brown color with biege head. In taste alot of maltyness and right on the spot roastyness. Quite light body for a dunkel. Nice beer

Shared a 50cl bottle. Pours a clear brown colour with a thin tan head. Aroma is caramel, roasted and malty. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is medium bitter and light sweet with a long dry finish. Overall, a very good beer with a much lighter body than thought in the first place.

Not a great beer, not bad or distasteful, just boring. Pours a very nice clear red with a thin white head. A bit of malt in the smell. Taste is really bland, almost like water with a hint of malt, and a weird bready finish. Had in the bottle.
Bottle, pours amber with a light brown head, slightly sweet malty with some chocolate and a little bit of bitterness. Nice beer.
Klar mørk rødbrun farve med lite lys beige skum. Lukt av malt, karamell, kaffe og krydder. Smak av malt, karamell, kaffe og frukt. Vaaland.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein rötlichbraunes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Karamell, leicht würzig. Geschmack leicht röstmalzig, leicht würzig, Karamell, leicht schokoladig.
500ml bottle. Deep dark red color. A slight coffee aroma. Metallic and slight coffee taste. An alright beer.
Drank from a bottle at home. Well balanced with a combination of smoke and sweet hops.

50cl bottles, Maruhn 2013. World class dunkel, setting old new Old World subtle standards in chocolate roast and dryness while remaining very sessionable at under 5%. Heiße Maroni, undercurrents of bock fruitiness. Pinnacle of back-to-basics bottom-fermenting, liquid elegant simplicity. Is it a coincidence that this is the 2nd world-class brewery in Kelheim with a flavour/yeast profile wholly its own?

This pours a clear, dark amber color with a slight, foamy head. The aroma is inviting with toasted malts and hazelnut tones. This is highly drinkable with a smooth texture and a decent sweet grain taste that is perfect for the style. Very well made and delicious.

Aroma; tannins, roasted malts, spices, notes of leather, egg, earthy notes, hints of rotten potato, but most of all herbs and spices.
Beige to off white head, brown red body, some dots and even curtain down the mug.
Taste; confectionery, caramel malts, chocolate, butter caramel, 
To palate easy, balanced, carbonated as it feels a bit foamy-creamy.
Finishes with malts, dark fruits, roasted grains, tasty. Overall worth an award. Ein sehr schönes Dunkelbier! Vielen Dank!

Bottle. It pours a very deep auburn color with an orange head. The flavor is similarly rich yet with great balance between earthy, spicy hops, bready and lightly toasted malt background with the brown sugar, molasses and light notes of raisins. The finish is very dry and toasted. The mouthfeel is velvety and smooth. Superb Dunkel.

0,5l bottle from beckot. Pours clear chestnut with a low head. Aroma is malts and rye. Watery flavor is malts, rye and some hops. Disappointing.

Bottle 0,50L. Nice one! Full flavour and a nice smell too it. A pretty "thick" taste and a surpise that it only has 4,7% alcohol!

Flaske fra supermercadoen i Elviria: dannet, beige kniplingskum og klar mahognyfarge. Aroma og smak: malt, karamell og brente mandler. Letthet og eleganse i kroppen skjuler en en noe kjedelig personlighet.

Una notable y suave cerveza de sesión, para cuando te hartes de sabores complejos. El caramelo abraza tu lengua. Sospecho de que es una botella con algo de solera, debido a su escasa espuma. Aunque habría que contrastarla con otros ejemplares. Plenamente disfrutable.

Botella de ½ lt. Jarra. Color ámbar brillante y apariencia cristalina. Espuma amarillenta y cremosa que crea una algodonosa corona que permanence como una persistente y fina capa en la superficie. Aromas florales, de maltas Crystal y trazos de chocolate. Entrada chispeante con sabores levemente dulzones y de moderado tostado. Cuerpo ligero y carbonatación moderada. 500ml bottle. Mug. Bright amber color, clear appearance. Yellowish, creamy foam creates a rocky crown. A thin & lasting layer remains on top. Floral, crystal malt aromas & chocolate hues. Crispy upfront with slight sweetness & moderate toasted flavors. Light body. Moderate carbonation. Dense texture & spicy touch. Gentle chocolate, dry nut & bitter cocoa flavors in the middle linger into a dry bitter/sweet finish. Well balanced & easy drinkable beer.
Clear brown colour. Aroma and flavour are both strong in caramel malt sweetness, bread dough and yeast. Very full flavoured.

dark reddish-brown colour, significant amount of stable beige head; aroma of toffee, roasted malt and fruits (grape and apple); taste of roasted malt and sugar with some bitterness and fruity notes; enjoyable dunkel

Bottle. Pours clear chestnut with a medium beige head that dissipates quickly leaving nice residual and lacing. Aroma is quite malty, dark sugars, toffee, caramel, something a bit odd. Flavor is malty and nutty, a tiny bit of smoke. Medium sweet with just a touch of balancing bitterness. Surprisingly full and creamy mouthfeel for the ABV. You know, I sometimes forget how good a nice German beer can be after being caught up in the hoppier, sourer, more barrel aged craze.

Bottle 0,50L. Crystal clear amber-brown colour with medium big light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, cacao, caramel, milk chocolate, white coffee, brown sugar. Taste follows aroma - moderate bitter with strong chocolate-cappucino taste and long lasting aftertaste. Medium to full body, with structure somewhere between watery and oily, soft carbonation. Best dunkel, I tried so far...

Bottled, 0.50l. Clear amber brown color, thick light brown head, good lacing and soft visible carbonation. Aroma of caramel, roasted malt, coffee and dried fruits. Taste starts with moderate sweet and roasted malt, followed by strong coffee and chocolate, with rich mouthfee, while finished moderately bitter with roasty aftertaste. 500ml bottle from Meny. Three finger light brown head which fades quickly. Dark red/brown clear body. Aroma is quite weak, with hints of malt and caramel. Taste is a little smoky. Not too bad, but pretty boring.
Bottle thanks to adnielsen. Pours a clear straw yellow color. Aroma is grains and honey. Flavor is more of the same, mainly honey. Light and drinkable, pretty good
Dark ruby color, one finger head. Aroma of roasted malts, bread, brown sugar. Taste is light sweet, light to medium bitter. Light body, thin texture, average carbonation. Nice, for a 4% ABV
Bottle 50 cl. Pours amber with medium frothy lacing head. Taste is blend of bread, chocolate, caramel, roasted malts and nuts. Very nice dunkel. Easy to drink with lots of flavor.

500 ml bottle. Pours clear red-brown with a medium brownish head. Roasty aroma with chocolate notes. A rich roasty malt taste, not too sweet, with notes of ingredients I cannot put my finger on. Mild palate. A wonderful beer.
Clear crimson-amber colour with a huge brown head. Wonderfully roasty caramel aroma with hints of hazelnut. Bittersweet taste with a full body. Long, roasty finish. Excellent beer.

Clear reddish brown beer with a big, beige, creamy head leaving a permanent layer on top of the beer and some lacing on the glass. Aroma has dark bread kind of lightly roasted malts and chocolate sweetness. Its also lightly watery. Taste is mostly malty sweet but also chocolaty and roasted. While in the mouth the beer is thinner than medium full and slightly watery. Heading towards the throat the rather high carbonation and rather high bitterness come up. The finish is quite long but rather mild, mostly sweet with some licorice. One of the best Dunkels in this ABV and price range.

The perfect dessert beer... Smooth, no acidic aftertaste... Beautiful consistent color... Nutty taste and aroma.

Getrunken im Kloster Weltenburg, hier schmeckt das Bier anders und besser als in der 0,5er Flasche, dank direkter Anbindung an die Brauerei und die einzigartigen Kieselfilter, unbedingt probieren!

from bottle. pours a clear, dark red/brown colour with a huge, frothy beige head. pleasent but rather weak aroma of roasted malts, caramel and nuts. low carbonation, medium body and kind of oily texture. not too sweet flavours of roasted malts, nuts, caramel and chocolate. long lasting smooth, chocolate-like aftertaste. really enjoyable dunkel!

500ml bottle (shared by FatPhil, thanks). Dark brown color. Small off-white head, stays. Grainy, malty, bready, dusty notes in aroma. Massive amount of roasted malts in flavor. Caramel and burnt sugar as well. Drinkable.

En god og forfriskende øl med mye særpreg og smak. Kjøpt på Meny Lørenskog (Triaden).

Malty and thick as one would expect from the style. The hops bitterness is more cloying than balanced. A fairly one dimensional malt profile. Aroma isn't unpleasant and color is gorgeous deep brown caramel.

0.5l bottle. Reddish dark brown body, beige head. Aroma of  reisins, caramel and roasted malts. Tastes like caramel, dark fruits with grassy hops and roasted malts. Aftertaste is a bit bitter. Nice beer.

Aroma: caramel, chocolate, toast, nuts, 
Appearance: red, clear, 
Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: full body, creamy, 
Overall: Una cerveza que compre por la etiqueta y realmente me termno gustando mucho y luego compre las demas dela misma cerveceria. Es suabe y bastante compleja. Si la ven, comprenla

Clear redish brown with small light brown foam head. Aroma is light caramel with some nut tones. Taste is malty caramel, OK beer. (Velp 201305)

Head: beige, medium, frothy, avg. retention. Colour: deep-red-brown, clear.

Aroma: caramel, toffee, malty, roasty. Taste: caramel, toffee, roasty finish. A decent dunkel, but nothing extraordinary.
Bottle. Pours slightly hazy darkish amber with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of malt and caramel. Sweetish, malty aroma with notes of caramel and dried fruit. Creamy mouthfeel. Good.
Pretty drinkable.  Dark and flavourful, not much head or carbonation.  Worth revisiting.

Cerveza color caoba rojizo, con espuma volátil. Olor achocolatado, afrutado. Sabor afrutado, cerezas, a miel, azucar de caña y notas de chocolate. Suave y va dejando un gusto a grano tostado suave en la boca.Cuerpo medio, algo graso pero el fondo es seco. Gas muy débil.

500ml bottle. Some malty, caramel and roasty aromas. Pours copper, a bit hazy, with nice offwhite head, vanishing, some lacing. Medium body, average carbonation, some crispy texture. Taste is malty, a bit roasty, some caramel and spices. Nice and ejoyable.
Rich and malty taste and a dark color. I think it's a bit to heavy to drink more than a few of it but definitely a really good one.
On draught at Leopolds Gasthaus in San Francisco.  Dark red-brown with a fine bubbly head.  Smooth, malty, with some nut.  Light malt aroma, sweet.  Very pleasant, one of the better dunkels.

Clear, dark brown with reddish tint and off-white head
Full bready malt aroma. Sweet but not very strong.
Taste has good roasted flavor and sweetness. Aftertaste has nice bitterness. Well balanced and structured flavor.

500ml bottle from Yormas in the Munich train station. Pours a clear, deep brown colored body with a slight reddish hue. Two finger-width, creamy, tan head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is rich caramels and toffees with a nice raisin bread and dark fruitiness, a touch of roast, nuts, and a hint of cocoa. Flavor is similar. RIch caramels with a really nice raisin bread sweetness, a slightly deep toffee, nuts, dark fruits, and another hint of cocoa. Finishes dry, but very clean and lightly roasted with a nice malt sweetness. Fairly lengthy aftertaste following a smooth, medium body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, an excellent dunkel. Rich, smooth, and malty with a nice dark fruit element and touch of roast. Great beer.

Aroma rich malt, dark toasty, slight chocolate,  nutty, .very nice rich malt sweetness.   Low bitterness, no off aromas or  flavors...rich brown looking with tan head.  Nice easy drinking rich dunkel. More rich malt flavor would be nice..a bit stale.
clear, dark red-brown with a fine head. nice aroma of chocolate, nuts, dark bread and some herbs. very well balanced with subtle sweet- and enough bitterness.

Pours deep orange reddish clear, with mocca rocky head. Aromas are caramel, grains, malts. Palate is slick, oily, medium bodied carbonation mouthful, soft smooth. Taste is sweetish, roast malty, with notes of floral hops and dryness. Finish is medium long, fruity with plums and has sweet and sour  end Easy to drink, texture is quite thick, overall good Dunkel , has some nice bock or/and stout qualities.

Bottle. Dark amber color. Slowly descending beige head that lasts for ages.
Quite dry aroma of roasted malt with notes of almond and butter. 
Pleasant, medium dry and slightly sugary taste of syrup. Creamy, slightly oily feel.

Bomber. Notes from tasting session. Good malt aroma: sweet and strong caramel. Flavors of raisinsand molasses. Som roast, burnt malt flavor, too, which lingers in the finish. Sweet, but not excessively. Really nicely balanced.

Pours dark nutty reddish with medium beige. Medium lacing. Aroma is malty profile, a bit earthy, toasted malt and a bit cocoa. Taste is nicely balanced between malty sweetness and  toasted and hopping bittery. Very nice brew. Dry finish, medium body and interesting forest type earthy notes in flavor.
Very tasty dunkel style brew. Has a load of malt and caramel texture and flavor. Pours a light brown with a decent level of carbonation. Malt and brown sugar on the nose, nice balance.
Clear mahogany color with lasting tan head. Dark bread, lagered caramel, mild chocolate aromas. medium body with average co2. Decent dark toast, mild chocolate, light peppery spicy flavors--not bad
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
The dunkel minimum standard others are set.  Palate is surprisingly light, creamy and soft.  Flavor has roasted malts, some sweetness, rye bread, fine.
Great with spicy meat is one of the best dunkles.

50 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 30.01.2009
Aroma is quite light with bready malt, roasted notes, hints of caramel and herbal notes. Flavour has bready malt, caramel, roastiness, hints of syrup and chocolate. Quite rich and nice for this ABV, one of the best dunkels Ive had.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090405.
Pours dark copper color with a medium head. Aroma of caramel, sugar, some ripe fruits and toffee notes. Flavor of malts, caramel, toffee and sugar. Too sweet for me.
Donkerbruine kleur. Redelijke kraag. Weinig aroma. Smaakt  moutig en weinig zoet. Redelijk waterig.

0,5l bottle. Reddish brown color with tan head. Appearance is very pleasing to the eye. Aroma is combination of lightly roasted malts, burned sugar and chocolate. Palate is good, but little bit thin for this type of beer imho. Taste little bitter and sweet. Good for its price.
Limpida con schiuma persistente e mediamente fine...olfatto dominato dal caramello e leggero tostato, al palato ritroviamo le stesse percezioni...birra semplice...

28/01/2013 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Bevuta al Deutsche Beer Festival. Ambrata carica, riflessi miele, limpida, schiuma biancastra normale, non molto persistente. Al naso malto, leggero tostato, leggero caramello, una punta leggermente sporca. In bocca è dolciastra, con note di caramello e leggero tostato, moscia, niente di che. Corpo medio, carbonazione normale. Appena sufficiente.

Aroma of milk chocolate, light roast, malt balls, slight waffle cone. Appearance is ruddy chocolate brown with tan head. Flavor is all malt- malt balls and milk chocolate with a semi-sweet, roasted finish. Palate is surprisingly light, creamy and soft. Excellent, though a bit thin on the palate, but that only makes it imminently drinkable.
Oh what a lovely palette of flavors. Rich malt sweetness of dried fruit and a little burnt tones finishing with balanced bitterness.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours clear reddish copper in color with a foamy beige head. Roasted malts, some sweetness and in aroma. Flavor has roasted malts, some nutty notes too and a bit of hoppy bitterness as well. Decent, even if it feels a bit thin.

Pours a deep reddish-brown with a very thin, quickly fading light tan head.  Rich roast-y biscuit aroma with hints of plum, raisin, carrot cake, and black licorice. Negligible hop aroma. Light body carbonation. Mildly sweet on the tip of the tongue. Über-malty and rich on the back-of-the-mouth taste buds. Very smooth going down, with a spicy and dry dark roast finish. Bitterness takes a seat at the back of the bus with the very clean yeast presence.

Tried it on a very bad day for a Dunkel. My stomach was saying no, and my heart was sending clear messages to my body that Dunkels are overrated. To my "surprise", this was bloody pleasant. Biscuits on the nose and a perfect balance on the taste between hoppy bitterness and malty sweetness. Well done!

50cl bottle at a pizzeria. Dark brown to ruby red color, clear, big brownish head. Nose is toasted grains. Aroma is roasted, toasted malts, bready, dark bread. Taste is mildly caramel-sweet with a proper hoppy balance. Good, tasty. Clean and nice Dunkel.

Cerveja nacional tipo Dunkel (Essa foi fabricada no Brasil, pela Petrópolis). Coloração preta avermelhada, com aroma de cravo e caramelo. O sabor tem um leve amargor (pouco lúpulo) com notas de cravo e caramelo, algo frutado. É uma puro malte escura, tipo abadia. Saborosa, com leve formação de espumas.

500 ml bottle.  Pours dark amber in color with a medium head.  The aroma is slightly smokey yet sweet.  The flavors are toasted grain, cooked sugar sweetness and a mild hop.  Medium body and smooth finish.
Bottle ar home. Medium brown color. Quite light brown head. Aroma of malts and bread. Quite nice.
Bottle at home. Mahogany brown color, medium sized white head, disappears quickly. Aroma of malts, rye bread. Taste: Roasty, malty, rye bread, some sweetness. Actually quite nice. Medium co2.

Bottle at home. Pour is deep brown, with a crimson tint, and small brown head; great lacing. Husky, raw straw, a touch of toffee, roast, wet dog, and metal in the aroma. Taste is raw grass, corn, rusted metal, grain, toasted malt, a touch of cocoa, and wood with a light metallic finish. Medium mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Very much a lager and not really my thing, but i appreciate the craft.

Half liter bottle from State Line Liquors. Pours a clear dark red-brown color with a large frothy brown head. Decent head retention. Aroma of dark wheat, chocolate, anise, nutty, almost roasted notes. The taste is light roasty notes, nutty notes, chocolate, coffee, spices, herbal hop finish. Medium bodied. Very nice beer.

Served in a glass mug at the Kloster where it is made.  Pours clear dark reddish brown with a tan head. The head has very good retention and leaves plenty of sticky lacing. Aroma: fine roasted malts with an overtone of hops. Quite malty flavor; sweet and bitter in balance. Light herbal hops.
Medium-light carbonation seems about perfect. Medium body.

O: A flawless albeit straightforward Bavarian dunkel. Make the pilgrimage.

500ml bottle. Clear darkest amber colour with average, firm, frothy, minimally lacing, beige head. Slightly roasty dark malty aroma. Taste is minimally sweet dark malty with notes of milk chocolate, nougat, cold coffee, a touch of roast. Contains a variety of dark malt flavours in mere suggestive manner.

brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam. 
caramel, chocolate, coffee, roasty, earthy, butterscotch, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium-full body, oily feel, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

500 ml bottle. L031. BB 31/10/2012. From mein-biershop.de.
Clear dark reddish brown colour with average sized fluffy tan head.
Toasted malt, grain, caramel and bread in aroma. 
Flavour is toasted malt, chocolate, bread, mild hops and touch of bitterness. Balanced and tasty Dunkel. Could be a bit richer but very good anyway.
Bottle from supermarket. Dark copper color, beige head. Malty taste with nuts, malts, caramel, bread and some coffee. Sweet, malty finish with some roastiness. Very good dunkel.

50cl bottle. Aroma has bread, roasty, coffee. Color is dark brown with slight red, light white head which leaves lacing. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, umami. Has a full body thick feel, soft carbonation, bitter. Overall very nice brew.

Bottle. Dark amber with a thin tan head. Aroma is rich malty caramel. Flavour is toasted malt nut and a hint of smoke. Finish is sweet and light dry

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2012 Bottle from HolAb, poured a dark mahogany with a cream-coloured head and aromas of prune and burnt caramel. Full bodied and creamy, with malt-fruit and burnt-bitter notes. Very nice.

This poured a very alluring ruby colour, with a big fluffy tan head and lots and lots of carbonation. At first the nose worried me as it bore a resemblance to detergent, but eventually it gave way to a predominantly ginger spiciness. Tastewise this was really nothing special, lightly malty but with a thin body it was quite disappointing to be frank.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 Mmmmmm. A badass Munich dunkel. Chocolate chip cookies, malts, with a nice bitter snap at the end. Mild carbonation, but really enjoyable. Sweet dark malts linger on the palate. Great beer.
UPDATED: DEC 25, 2012 red brownish color with creamy head. caramel and hazel sweet scent and taste,medium body
Dark brown with cream colored head. Soft creamy and malty scent. Tastes is light on palate. Smooth creamy.
UPDATED: NOV 15, 2012 50cl bottle. Pours a small white head. Dark brown color. Aroma of raisins, chocolate and nuts. Tastes a lot of chocolate, some sugar, hint of cookies or bread.

Tasted from tall bottle into nonic pint. It poured a clear reddish copper brown color with immense off-white foam, everlasting with lots of lace. A perfectly beautiful appearance. Aromas of bread, husky cereal grains, perfumey noble hops, toast. Flavor was malty but mostly dry, reminiscent of darkly toasted raisin bread. Fruitier than most lagers. Nice light body, mouthfeel was somehow grainy and smooth at the same time, "digestive" like a good Belgian ale.
Very smooth.  Brown bread.  Thin head.  Somewhat sweet maltiness.  crisp.  A lot of lace.
Dark brown body with a small beige head. Aroma is cherry and caramel. Malty sweet finish. Medium bodied with an oily texture and a soft carbonation.
0,5 l bottle shared with McTapps. If you like malt youre right here. Superb coffee, catsmel and huge malt aroma. Maybe a bit to tough and not easy enough to drink, but a great beer.
UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Greatest beer in a long time. Dark in colour, aromas of pumpernickel (German dark bread), very sweetish and just delicious!
Bottle. Dark amber colour with large creamy off-white mostly lasting head. Aroma is roasted malt. Sweet flavor. Oily palate.

Pours a deep reddish brown with a big fluffy off white head and lots of lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is sticky sweet, hazel-nutty, very malty and aromatic. 

I was almost concerned with how sweet this one smells, that it might taste a bit over-sweet. It has a lot of malt flavor but not much of that is sticky sweetness. Nutty & bitter all around. Plenty of hazelnut, lightly oaky, lightly sweet. The beer is really strikingly bitter, far more bitter than what I generally associate with a Dunkel, but in such a nice way. The hops are herbaceous and bordering on intrusive without really crossing that line. Id  say this is one enjoyable, rich, and challenging beer. 

Will buy again (if it stays around town)
From old backlog. Dark brown colour with bug head. Aroma is roasted, malt. Flavour is malt, sweet.

Aroma has lots of slightly roasted, sweet malt. looks like diluted cola. Frothy beige head and lacing. Taste is sweet and malty without much nuances. Light to almost watery, sweet, standard carbonation. Malty and sweet and thin. Lacks nuances and good flavors.

Thank you Julia Dubowy for another fine gift from your latest trip to Germany.  Clear dark ruby amber with a foamy head and big streaks of lace.  Taste begins with a slightly bitter caramel malt that grows, adding dark fruit and toast along with a bit of molasses.  Light bittering at the finish keeps everything nicely balanced.  Easy to drink, highly sessionable.  Recommended.
Bottled. I liked this Dopple from them too. A bit of dark malts, roast and dark fruit. Nice caramel and sweet mat finish.

10-JUL-2012, bottle @Casa Chumbo in Malaga.
Clear brown with tan head.
Yeasty and bready like in rye bread with a hint of pumpernickel. Yeast and spice as well. Roasted with coffee and caramel. Thin body, high carbonation. Very brown ale like.

Wow! This is  what a dunkel should be....coffee brown clor with two finger beige head, nice roast, nutty flavor and bitterness in the aftertaste. Weltenburger has become my favorite German brewery. Rich and tasty, absolutely gorgeous!

Red color with a medium head.  Aroma of raisins and chocolate.  Light palate.  Some raisin and chocolate notes.  A little roast too.  Not too sweet and very balanced.  Very much a session-able dark beer.

Pours bronze / brown with a small tan head.  The aroma has dough, toffee, toasted lager maltiness, smooth nuts and is quite full and malty.  Medium body thats got a crispness and some semi-sharp carbonation.  The flavor begins with toffee, brown sugar, peppery spice, toast and a dryness considering the descriptors that I used.  The finish adds some mineral traits and finishes quite dry.  Nice dunkel.

500mL. Pours clear cola with a medium, beige head. Webby, thicker lace. Nose is brown sugar, twizzlers, dark fruits. Taste is minerally, bland, soapy, drained. No richness. Probably an old bottle. No body. No rich maltiness. Disappointing.
(bottle) medium brown with light tan head. Aroma of slightly sweet malt. Flavor is roasted sweet malt, a little woody.

Bottle.  Pours a medium-dark brown with a nice tan head.  Nutty, caramel, roasted aromas.  Very smooth with caramel and nutty flavors.  I first tried this beer while at the Weltenburg Abbey two years ago.  Prior to that trip to Germany, I wasnt a big fan of dunkels, but this beer in particular changed my mind.  This is probably my favorite dunkel that Ive tried.
Pours dark brown with a nice beige head. The aroma is sweet, caramel and chocolate, while the taste has a roasted malty sweetness, being quite smooth, elegant and refreshing. Nice session dark beer.

Brownish colour with an off white head. Malty caramel nose. Moderate malty flavour with some light fruity notes and light sweetness.Fresh and nice dunkel.[Bottle from Meny Tista-senter in Halden, Norway]

Die Schaumkrone dieses Rotbraunen Bieres hält gut, schön! Es riecht süß-lakritzartig-malzig. Geschmacklich ist es schön hopfig, leicht bittermalzig, dies erinnert an Kaffee. Die Geschmacksintensivität gefällt mir hier sehr gut, sie ist nicht zu stark und nicht zu mild. Im Nachgeschmack überwiegt eine röstigbittere Malzigkeit. Fazit: Ordentliches Klosterdunkel..
